SEARCH
Package ru.introguzzle.parsers.xml.entityUnion

Class XMLDocument

java.lang.Object
ru.introguzzle.parsers.xml.entityUnion.XMLDocument
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Consumer<Visitor<XMLDocument>>, Visitable<XMLDocument,Visitor<XMLDocument>>, JSONObjectConvertable, XMLDocumentConvertable, XMLStringConvertable
public class XMLDocument extends Object implements Serializable, JSONObjectConvertable, XMLDocumentConvertable, XMLStringConvertable, Visitable<XMLDocument,Visitor<XMLDocument>>
Represents an XML document and provides functionalities for converting between XML and JSON representations, as well as deserializing XML data into Java objects.

The XMLDocument class serves as a foundational component within the deserialization framework, enabling the transformation of XML data into various formats and Java object structures. It implements multiple interfaces to support conversion to JSON objects, XML strings, and visitation patterns.

Key Features:

  • Serialization and deserialization between XML and JSON formats.
  • Conversion of XML data into Java objects using registered ObjectMapper instances.
  • Support for versioning and encoding metadata.
  • Integration with the Visitor design pattern for traversing XML documents.
  • Caching and management of ObjectMapper instances for efficient deserialization.

Example Usage:


 // Create an XMLDocument instance with version, encoding, and root element
 Version version = Version.V1_0;
 Encoding encoding = Encoding.UTF_8;
 XMLElement rootElement = new XMLElement("company");
 XMLDocument xmlDocument = new XMLDocument(version, encoding, rootElement);

 // Convert XMLDocument to JSON
 JSONObject jsonObject = xmlDocument.toJSONObject();

 // Register an ObjectMapper for the Company class
 ObjectMapper companyMapper = new CompanyObjectMapper();
 XMLDocument.bindTo(Company.class, companyMapper);

 // Deserialize XMLDocument to a Company object
 Company company = xmlDocument.toObject(Company.class);

Exception Handling:

  • XMLMappingException: Thrown when deserialization fails due to issues like missing mappers, type mismatches, or other mapping-related errors.

Thread Safety:

The XMLDocument class maintains a static map of ObjectMapper instances, which is not thread-safe. If multiple threads are expected to register or deregister mappers concurrently, consider synchronizing access to the MAPPERS map or using a thread-safe map implementation.

    • bindTo

      public static void bindTo(Class<?> type, ObjectMapper mapper)
      Binds an ObjectMapper to a specific Java class type for deserialization.

      Once an ObjectMapper is bound to a class, it will be used to deserialize XMLDocument instances into objects of that class.

      Parameters:
      type - The Java class type to bind the mapper to.
      mapper - The ObjectMapper instance to bind.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type or mapper is null.

    • bindTo

      public static void bindTo(Class<?>[] types, ObjectMapper mapper)
      Binds an ObjectMapper to multiple Java class types for deserialization.

      Each class in the provided array will be associated with the specified ObjectMapper, enabling the mapper to deserialize XMLDocument instances into objects of those classes.

      Parameters:
      types - An array of Java class types to bind the mapper to.
      mapper - The ObjectMapper instance to bind.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if types or mapper is null.

    • bindTo

      public static void bindTo(@NotNull @NotNull Set<Class<?>> types, @NotNull @NotNull ObjectMapper mapper)
      Binds an ObjectMapper to multiple Java class types for deserialization.

      Each class in the provided set will be associated with the specified ObjectMapper, enabling the mapper to deserialize XMLDocument instances into objects of those classes.

      Parameters:
      types - A set of Java class types to bind the mapper to.
      mapper - The ObjectMapper instance to bind.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if types or mapper is null.

    • unbind

      public static void unbind(@NotNull @NotNull Class<?> type)
      Unbinds the ObjectMapper associated with the specified Java class type.

      After unbinding, the specified class will no longer have an associated mapper, and attempting to deserialize XMLDocument instances into objects of that class will result in an exception.

      Parameters:
      type - The Java class type to unbind the mapper from.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type is null.

    • unbindAll

      public static void unbindAll()
      Unbinds all ObjectMapper instances from their associated Java class types.

      After invoking this method, no class types will have an associated mapper, and attempting to deserialize XMLDocument instances into any class will result in an exception.

    • toObject

      @NotNull public <T> T toObject(@NotNull @NotNull Class<T> type)
      Convenient method for deserializing this XML document into an instance of the specified Java class type.

      This method utilizes the ObjectMapper bound to the specified class to perform the deserialization. If no mapper is bound to the class, an XMLMappingException is thrown.

      Example:

      
 Company company = xmlDocument.toObject(Company.class);
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the resulting object.
      Parameters:
      type - The Java class type to deserialize the XML document into.
      Returns:
      An instance of type T representing the deserialized XML data.
      Throws:
      XMLMappingException - If no mapper is bound to the specified class or if deserialization fails.
      NullPointerException - If type is null

    • toXMLDocumentWithMetadata

      public XMLDocument toXMLDocumentWithMetadata()
      Converts this XMLDocument to an XMLDocument with additional metadata.

      Currently, this method returns null and should be implemented to include metadata if required.

      Specified by:
      toXMLDocumentWithMetadata in interface XMLDocumentConvertable
      Returns:
      An XMLDocument instance with metadata, or null if not implemented.
